ollama_generated:
In the AZUL–ATR Global Maintenance Master Agreement DS/CS-3957/14/Issue 7 on Page 10/110 issued by AZUL SA, the following terms have specific meanings:

- "MPD" or "Maintenance Planning Document" refers to documents provided by the Aircraft manufacturer that outline periodic maintenance requirements data for planning and conducting aircraft maintenance checks and inspections. These documents are in effect on the Signing Date.
- "MRBR" stands for the Maintenance Review Board Report, which outlines the minimum initial maintenance requirements necessary for the development of an approved continuous airworthiness maintenance program for the Aircraft. This report is issued by the Maintenance Review Board (MRB).
- "Measured Removal Rate(s)" or "MRR" indicates, depending on the aircraft age, the quantity of LRU removals per one thousand (1,000) Flight Hours (FH), measured during each period of three (3) consecutive calendar months of aircraft activity during the Term for all LRUs listed in Exhibit 6 ("LRUs covered by repair and standard exchange Services") excluding Main Elements and/or Main Element subassemblies, repair warranty items, and "Rogue" units.
- A "Month" is a period starting on one day in a calendar month and ending on the numerically corresponding day in the next calendar month. If such a period would otherwise end on a non-Business Day, it shall end on the next Business Day. However, if a period starts on the last Business Day in a calendar month or if there is no numerically corresponding day in the month in which that period ends, that period shall end on the last Business Day in the following month.
- "NFF" or "No Fault Found" denotes any event where an item removed from an aircraft by the Company and returned to the Repairer for repair is declared serviceable with non-confirmed fault by the latter through strip report, or where a serviceable item removed from the Pool by the Repairer and delivered to the Company under the standard exchange Service set out in Exhibit 9 ("Spare parts standard exchange Service") is returned by the Company to the Repairer unused.
- "Notice" pertains to any notice or communication regarding this Agreement, which shall be given in writing, either by hand delivery and/or courier service with proof of delivery and/or fax.

ollama_generated:
(i) The Lessee shall ensure that the Aircraft is operated and maintained in accordance with all relevant technical manuals, guidelines, and instructions provided by ATR and the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM). Additionally, the Lessee shall be responsible for removing and installing Line Replaceable Units (LRUs) and Main Elements on the Aircraft.

   (ii) The Lessee shall adhere to any Airworthiness Directives (AD) and, at the Lessee's discretion, incorporate or make necessary modifications to the Aircraft based on their orders. The Lessee will manage the update of the Aircraft, LRUs, Main Elements, technical notices, and log books, delivering a copy of these documents to the Repairer following each maintenance event or upon request.

   (iii) If the Lessee or their insurer intends to disassemble any LRU or Main Element at the Repair Shop, they shall promptly inform the Repairer.

   (iv) The Lessee will provide the Repairer with an activity report detailing each Aircraft and Main Element serial number, including hours flown (FH), cycles performed, Technical Service Notices (TSN), Component Service Notices (CSN), Time since last overhaul (TSO), Cycle since last overhaul (CSO), and removals/installations events for each Aircraft and Main Element during the preceding month. This report should be submitted to the Repairer not later than the tenth (10th) day of each subsequent month.

   (v) In the event that any Aircraft is temporarily out of service, the Lessee shall preserve the Aircraft, as well as any Main Elements and sub-assemblies, in accordance with the Aircraft Maintenance Manual (AMM). This clause does not apply if the Company has a separate agreement with the Repairer regarding storage of temporarily unused aircraft.

   (vi) The Lessee shall maintain primary responsibility for the condition and maintenance of the Aircraft and its components, including any LRUs and Main Elements, except in cases where specific responsibilities are explicitly delegated to the Repairer under this agreement or other applicable agreements.

Rewritten clause with subtle changes:

Under this Agreement, AZUL SA shall supply and install the Equipment listed below (the "Equipment"), but the Responsibility for ensuring that the Equipment is properly maintained and operated shall lie with ATR. Any repairs or replacements required due to normal wear and tear or accidents shall be performed at ATR's expense.

The Equipment includes, without limitation:
- CORE AVIONICS CABINET INPUT OUTPUT MODULE-DC and CORE AVIONICS CABINET INPUT OUTPUT MODULE-S
- The INTEGRATED CORE PROCESSING MODULE
- PRINTER models ICP 110VM, ICP 111VM (2 units), ICP 112VM, ICP 114VM, ICP 131VM (2 units), ICP 132VM, ICP 400VM, ICP 401VM, ICP 402VM, ICP 404VM, ICP 6VM, ICP 811VM
- The CENTRAL MAIN INSTRUMENT and PANEL LIGHT
- The LIGHT MANAGEMENT UNIT and TCAS DIRECTIONAL ANTENNA
- T2CAS Computers (2 units)
- PROBE-PITOT, EJECTION DUCT, BUS POWER CONTROL UNIT, BATTERY-EMERGENCY, and AFTER ROLLER BLIND

In the event that any of the Equipment fails to function properly or needs to be replaced due to obsolescence, AZUL SA shall notify ATR immediately, and ATR shall arrange for its repair or replacement at its own cost. However, in such cases, AZUL SA shall provide reasonable assistance in identifying the necessary replacement parts and ensuring their availability.

Confidential material redacted and filed separately with the Securities and Exchange Commission.
